Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: keen cursors
content:
I had my own cursor as well.
It had BWB as the main cursor, spinning BWB for loading, Little Ampton for help, Bounder for the little slashed-out-circle thing, Spirogrip for the resize arrows, and Slicestar for moving.
I should go look for them.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] -Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: keen cursors
content:
You should try and get them added to the PCKF.
Fx has supported custom cursors for a while (just .CUR, not .ANI, and I don't think .PNG either), and IE started doing it with version 7 (the latest).

Basically something similar to the following should be added to the CSS:

body {cursor: url("Arrow.cur"), default;}
a {cursor: url("Link.cur"), pointer;}

The first tells the browser to show "Arrow.cur" all over the site, or the default cursor (usually an arrow) if it can't load the custom one (it's generally good practice to have fallback stuff).
The second line means links should have "Link.cur", or the default "pointer", usually a small hand.
You can have custom cursors for when hovering over images, paragraphs, whatever, if you want, but that'll just make things confusing.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]
